data.title: Great food and atmosphere!
data.text: I enjoyed my dining experience at Pignetti's.  The atmosphere is friendly, with an almost family "tinge".  Tables are close, so customers greet each other across tables!  The wine list was extensive, we found a bottle that met our satisfaction.  The crab cakes were adequate....the entrees, very good and seasoned well!  I would definitely return!

data.title: Wedding rehearsal
data.text: We had them cater are wedding rehearsal. Everything was perfect from the use of the projector, the music, and l especially the food. Robert was awesome and everything was great.

data.title: Good food ok atmospere
data.text: I was impressed with the food which was great. Great selection of wine. The dining area was not that great. I was not thrilled with the restaurant because there were so many boxes of wine all over the place. I had to walk around them to navigate through the restaurant.

data.title: Big improvement over my last visit in August 2016
data.text:
I wanted to update my old review of Pignetti's restaurant.
I took my girlfriend to Pignetti's for her birthday.  I called for reservations and specifically requested a table on the far side of the dinning room entry way since the last time I was there it was like having a table on the freeway...way too much traffic and the old wooden floors shook the table whenever someone stepped down into the dinning room.  The gentleman taking the reservations was aware of the problem with the floor and volume of traffic in that area.

We arrived about 15 minutes early and were given a table on the opposite wall where traffic was at a minimum, the floor was solid and our waitress was outstanding.  She knew the menu, she knew how the dishes were prepared and got our bill right the first time.

I have always liked Pignetti's Chicken Marsala, but that was not on the menu.  I decided on the Triple Delight which is chicken, sausage and shrimp pasta in a tomato cream sauce.  My girlfriend had the Fettuccine Pignetti.   Both dishes were excellent as was the service.  For dessert we shared a slice of Lemoncello Cake which was absolutely divine!

If you do make reservations, I recommend that you not accept a table along the dinning room entry wall since that is were the most traffic going in and out will be passing bye.  But once you get a good table, you will love the food!

data.title: GG
data.text: Incredible atmosphere, professional wait staff, awesome food and I am at a loss of words for the wine collection. Wish I had pictures of the wine offerings. My favorite resturant in Temple, Texas.

data.title: We Love Pignetti's
data.text:
This is a great place for a fine meal with the entire family.  We had our 6 year old granddaughter with us and she loved the pizza.  The wine list is extensive.  The menu offers many choices.  My favorite is a salmon dish with vegetables - very heart healthy!
I can't count how many times we have dined at Pignett's but we dine here every time we visit close friends in Temple or attend Baylor football games in Waco.  I cannot remember when our first visit was but it was at least 10 years ago.
We will be back!

data.title: Great food!
data.text: This is a great date night place. The food is absolutely great as well as the service and the atmosphere. A great place in down town Temple.

data.title: Very nice.  Professional staff.  Great menu.  Try it. You will like it.
data.text:
Up scale.  Great menu.   Worth the price and great service.  Try it soon
Good atmosphere and setting    Parking is limited.

data.title: Good Italian in downtown Temple
data.text: Tasty Italian food wth lots of wine choices.  Use restaraunt.com for great coupons.  Love the prime rib lasagna.

data.title: Good Food Over Priced
data.text: The food and service was good....not great considering the price.  The wine pour was low and when questioned they said it was 8 oz.  It wasn't but I wasn't going to argue.  I guess it was their way of encouraging you to buy the bottle.

data.title: Great Food and Casual Dining
data.text: my wife and I go here quite often and we've taken all our friends and family here at one time or another.  Service and food always superb.

data.title: Excellent Food and Service
data.text: I had lunch today at Pignetti's and was impressed with this establishment. Service was polite and efficient. The food was delicious. The restaurant is clean, quiet and has old European charm. I will return for future meals.

data.title: WOW!  Who knew?
data.text: On a cool and rainy day, when the school teachers are back at work prepping for the upcoming year, my wife and I celebrated her retirement with a movie and a late lunch.  We found Pignetti's and decided to give it a try.  WOWZERS!  In the middle of downtown, nice outside dining area, inside was reminiscent of Italy in just about every aspect.  We were greeted and seated promptly.  The background music was subdued and melodic, so we could actually converse with each other without yelling.  The server was excellent!  The food was superb!  The Ceasar salad was fresh, and dressing was very flavorful, and the portions of each component of the meal were ample. My Tuscan chicken in a lemon creme was astoundingly good!  My wife wasn't interested in sampling it because her chicken fettuccine was some of the best she ever had.  The lemon cake dessert was likewise superb.  We told the lady who served us of how good everything was, and she proclaimed that Pignetti's is the best restaurant in town.  I agree wholeheartedly with her.  So now I am looking for any excuse to go back there.  We will probably patronize Pignetti's monthly from here on out.  I want to try everything on their extensive menu.  It was GREAT!

data.title: Nothing Special but Average Italian
data.text: Typical Italian, bring me some type of olive oil with secret herbs to put in it to dip my bread, which was hard. Did have a unique Ribeye Lasagna but wasn't overly impressed with the taste. Haven't been back.

data.title: Date Night
data.text: Great atmosphere, food and wine as always. It is our go to place to relax and enjoy a very good meal at night. Upscale Italian with pasta, seafood, chicken and steak.

data.title: Nice surprise in Temple.
data.text: Came to Temple for a meeting. My colleague suggested coming here.  Great wine list delivered via an iPad.  Good service.  I had the eggplant dish...wasn't impressed.  It wasn't bad, just not what I was expecting.  We will be back to give the place another try...and probably get the Pasta Trio.

data.title: Catered wedding
data.text: We attended a wedding on Saturday (06/25/16) which was catered by Pignetti's. The food was delicious and the servers were young, energetic and respectful.

data.title: Manufique
data.text: This is a quaint, classy, unique Italian restaurant with a 1st class wine selection and a full bar.  Select your wine from a tablet with a full description of each wine.  The food is fabulous and affordable.  The staff are fantastic.  The owner, Clint, is always there talking with customers and assure  quality and a great experience. We drive about 45 miles round trip but know it will be well worth it.

data.title: Perfect lunch
data.text: Visited to meet a business acquaintance for the first time in person.  My colleague is a resident of Austin.  She mentioned to me that the location was perfect for her as she was en route to Dallas.  She ordered the lasagne, I ordered the tilapia with veggies..yummeriffic!!! Will definitely be dining there again!

data.title: Tables to close
data.text: Tables are to close. Not easy to get up and get around others  & cannot have a private conversation. More noted for the wine, than Italian food.  Service was lacking a bit. Not sure why, it was not busy.
